meanings.definition: Not staying the same or not remaining unchanged.
meanings.sent1: The weather in our city is very nonconstants, always changing from hot to cold.
meanings.sent2: Her mood was nonconstants, shifting from happy to sad throughout the day.
meanings.sent3: The nonconstants weather made it difficult to plan a picnic.
meanings.sent4: His nonconstants behavior was like a rollercoaster ride, unpredictable and exciting.
meanings.sent5: The nonconstants nature of the stock market keeps investors on their toes.

meanings.definition: Something that is not constant or does not stay the same.
meanings.sent1: In science class, we learned about nonconstants like the changing seasons.
meanings.sent2: The only thing certain in life is nonconstants, like unexpected surprises.
meanings.sent3: The nonconstants of the internet can be both frustrating and fascinating.
meanings.sent4: Her love for adventure was a nonconstants that drove her to explore new places.
meanings.sent5: The nonconstants of human behavior never cease to amaze psychologists.
